clinical_study.official_title: A Prospective Study to Evaluate the Longterm Treatment Results After Micro-surgical Root Resection of Teeth With Post and Core and Crown

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of the study is to evaluate the longterm treatment results after micro-surgical root resection of teeth with post and core and crown.

detailed_description.textblock:
All 73 patients, who have been treated with apicoectomy on teeth with post and core and crown between the years 2004 and 2006 and who have already been followed up in 2008, will be followed up once more in 2017.
The patients will have a clinical and radiologic examination. The investigators will examine if new periapical lesions, bone loss, fracture of teeth or loss of teeth exist.

primary_outcome.measure: Appearance of periapical lesions on tooth after root resection
primary_outcome.description: Appearance assessed by X-ray and classified according to Molven et al. (1987)

primary_outcome.measure: Size of periapical lesions on tooth after root resection
primary_outcome.description: Size assessed by X-ray and classified according to Molven et al. (1987)

secondary_outcome.measure: Vertical and horizontal bone loss on the tooth after root resection
secondary_outcome.description: Bone loss in mm assessed by X-ray and probing
Number of tooth fractures assessed by X-ray
Number of tooth losses assessed by clinical and radiological evaluation

intervention.description: To get further and actual information about periapical lesions, different x-rays will be done (panoramic radiographic, small picture ray, cone beam computed tomography). Furthermore a periodontal status will be performed.

study_pop.textblock: 73 patients, who have been treated with apicoectomy on teeth with post and core and crown between the years 2004 and 2006 and who have already been followed up in 2008, will be followed up once more in 2017.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- All 73 patients, who were treated with apicoectomy on teeth with post and core and crown between the years 2004 and 2006 and who have already been followed up in 2008, will be followed up once more in 2017.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Pregnancy
- Patients who do not want to participate in clinical and radiological follow up.
